item.title: Intro to Style Transfer
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: Image Style Transfer Using Convolutional Neural Networks This paper introduced neural style transfer. It uses a VGGNet pre-trained on the ImageNet dataset for the purpose. The key idea is to be able to separate content and style from the representations of the network. Once that is done, a new image is synthesized from white noise where two different kind of losses are minimized - a style loss between the style image and the hybrid image, and a content loss between the content image and the hybrid image.

item.title: Building your first RNN
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: If you have some understanding of recurrent networks, want to get your hands dirty, but haven’t really tried to do that on your own, then you are certainly at the right place. This tutorial is a practical guide about getting started with recurrent networks using PyTorch. We’ll solve a simple cipher using PyTorch 0.4.0, which is the latest version at the time of this writing. You are only expected to have some understanding of recurrent networks.

item.title: Persistent Mounts
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: After installing your linux distro, though you’ll be able to access your Windows/NTFS partitions easily, things can get annoying sometimes with you having to mount the partition manually everytime. Here I describe how to get away with this mess by automatically mounting partitions on boot. You could also do the same from Unity using the Disks utility, but here I describe the so called hard way. The way we do it is by editing the /etc/fstab file.
